name: BigData Developer (Python, BigQuery, Airflow)
description:
Our client is one of the biggest American department store retail chains, which states that technology and innovation are cornerstones of their business.

Our customer’s project is about migration of data from on-prem Teradata to Google BigQuery. So, by joining the project you will get an opportunity of gaining hands-on and in-depth experience with BigQuery and will take a part in transforming this migration into a reusable capability and accelerator by Grid Dynamics.

Responsibilities:

  • Migrate data from Teradata to BigQuery
  • Provide quality data solutions in a timely manner and be responsible for data governance and integrity while meeting objectives and maintaining SLAs
  • Improve and maintain the data infrastructure
  • Work closely with data scientists and analysts to create and deploy new features
  • Built departmental data-marts for supporting analytics across the company
  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements
  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team
  • Mentor and educate team members to adopt best practices in writing and maintaining production code
  • Communicate clearly and effectively to technical and non-technical audience

Required skills:

  • Proven skills in Python, SQL, GCP, Big Query
  • Experience with Airflow
  • Ability to perform paired programming, test-driven development
  • Ability to deliver quality, clean, scalable, reusable, and supportable code
  • Intermediate of English

Nice to have:

  • Working experience Teradata
  • Good communication skills

We offer:

  • Opportunity to work on bleeding-edge projects
  • Work with a highly motivated and dedicated team
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible schedule
  • Medical insurance
  • Benefits program
  • Corporate social events

About us:

Grid Dynamics is the engineering services company known for transformative, mission-critical cloud solutions for retail, finance and technology sectors. We architected some of the busiest e-commerce services on the Internet and have never had an outage during the peak season. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Ramon, California with offices throughout the US and Eastern Europe, we focus on big data analytics, scalable omnichannel services, DevOps, and cloud enablement.
